node.title: Kiwi sporting greats Carrington, Pascoe given ultimate accolade in New Years Honours list
node.description: Both women have been recognised for their remarkable achievements.
node.content: ["Olympic and Paralympic greats Lisa Carrington and Sophie Pascoe have both been named Dames of the New Zealand Order of Merit in the New Years Honours list.\n", "In Tokyo this year, canoe racing star Carrington became New Zealand's most successful Olympian, with her haul of three gold medals, taking her total haul to five golds and a bronze across three different Olympics to surpass equestrian rider Sir Mark Todd and fellow paddlers Ian Ferguson and Paul MacDonald.", "She also became the first Kiwi woman to win three gold medals at a single Olympics.", "\"It's really special,\" Carrington tells Newshub of her latest accolade. \"It's just a huge honour to be recognised.\"", "Pascoe continued her remarkable run as New Zealand's most decorated Paralympian in Tokyo, taking her medal tally to 19, of which 11 are gold.", "The 28-year-old has also been a vocal advocate for equality for people challenged with disabilities.", "Carrington was crowned Sportswoman of the Decade at this year's Halberg Awards, while Pascoe took home Para-Athlete of the Decade.", "Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says both Pascoe and Carrington are at a level of their own and their contributions go beyond simply competition.", "\"No one who saw them will forget Lisa Carrington's golden days on the water in Tokyo earlier this year,\" says Ardern.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"But she is far more than our greatest ever Olympian. Humble and kind she is a role model for girls and boys across the country and continues to give back through her coaching of young paddlers.", "\"Sophie Pascoe is our greatest Paralympian, winning 19 medals across four Paralympic Games. A groundbreaker and trendsetter she is a role model within and beyond the disability community and an advocate for equality.\"", "\u00a0"]
